properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 14 at 8:10PM EST by NWS Charleston WV
properties.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio...
West Virginia...

Ohio River At Point Pleasant affecting Gallia and Mason Counties.

For the Ohio River...Minor flooding is forecast.

The Flood Warning continues for
the Ohio River At Point Pleasant.
* Until further notice.
* At 8:00 PM EST Friday the stage was 43.4 feet.
* Flood stage is 40.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending
at 8:00 PM EST Friday was 43.6 feet. The river has crested and is
beginning to slowly fall.
* Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early
Sunday morning.
* Impact...At 43.0 feet, Ohio Route 7 at Kyger Creek and Addison is
flooded.
* Impact...At 43.5 feet, Route 33 at West Creek and Brinker Run
between Vanadium and Letart is flooded. Sand Hill Road near Letart
is flooded.
properties.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive
cars through flooded areas.

Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

This warning will be in effect until the river falls below its flood
stage.

Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.

Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rlx.

The next statement is expected to be issued early Saturday morning.

NWSheadline: The Flood Warning is now in effect until Monday, January 18
